pyFprime.Element¶

Element: functions for element types

copyright:2008, Robert B. Von Dreele (Argonne National Laboratory)
class pyFprime.Element.DeleteElement(parent)[source]¶

Delete element from selected set widget

pyFprime.Element.FPcalc(Orbs, KEv)[source]¶

Compute real & imaginary resonant X-ray scattering factors

Parameters:
  • Orbs (list) – list of orbital dictionaries as defined in GetXsectionCoeff
  • KEv (float) – x-ray energy in keV
Returns:

C: (f’,f”,mu): real, imaginary parts of resonant scattering & atomic absorption coeff.
pyFprime.Element.GetAtomInfo(El)[source]¶
Parameters:El (str) – 2 character element symbol
pyFprime.Element.GetFormFactorCoeff(El)[source]¶

Read form factor coefficients from atmdata.dat file

Parameters:El – element 1-2 character symbol case irrevelant
Returns:FormFactors: list of form factor dictionaries

each dictionary is:

'Symbol':4 character element symbol with valence (e.g. 'NI+2')
'Z': atomic number
'fa': 4 A coefficients
'fb': 4 B coefficients
'fc': C coefficient
pyFprime.Element.GetMagFormFacCoeff(El)[source]¶

Read magnetic form factor data from atmdata.dat file

Parameters:El (str) – 2 character element symbol
Returns:MagFormFactors: list of all magnetic form factors dictionaries for element El.

each dictionary contains:

'Symbol':Symbol
'Z':Z
'mfa': 4 MA coefficients
'nfa': 4 NA coefficients
'mfb': 4 MB coefficients
'nfb': 4 NB coefficients
'mfc': MC coefficient
'nfc': NC coefficient
pyFprime.Element.GetXsectionCoeff(El)[source]¶

Read atom orbital scattering cross sections for fprime calculations via Cromer-Lieberman algorithm

Parameters:El – 2 character element symbol
Returns:Orbs: list of orbitals each a dictionary with detailed orbital information used by FPcalc

each dictionary is:

'OrbName': Orbital name read from file
'IfBe' 0/2 depending on orbital
'BindEn': binding energy
'BB': BindEn/0.02721
'XSectIP': 5 cross section inflection points
'ElEterm': energy correction term
'SEdge': absorption edge for orbital
'Nval': 10/11 depending on IfBe
'LEner': 10/11 values of log(energy)
'LXSect': 10/11 values of log(cross section)
class pyFprime.Element.PickElement(parent, list)[source]¶

Makes periodic table widget for picking element - caller maintains element list

pyFprime.Element.ScatFac(FormFac, SThL)[source]¶

compute value of form factor

Parameters:
  • FormFac (dict) – dictionary defined in GetFormFactorCoeff()
  • SThL (float) – sin-theta/lambda
Returns:

f: real part of form factor
Return type:

float
pyFprime.Element.locate_distribution_file(name)[source]¶

locate a standard data file supplied in the distribution directory

Returns:full, absolute path to file, in this directory or None
Return type:str or None
